newsitem.title: FRANCE: Iberia ups ex-France air cargo rates March.
newsitem.headline: Iberia ups ex-France air cargo rates March.

text.p: Spanish state airline, Iberia, said it plans to increase its ex-France cargo rates by between three and five percent, effective March 1.

"Market conditions are favourable at the moment with Latin America - notably Mexico,Venezuela, Brazil, Argentina and Chile - generating a buoyant level of demand," a Paris-based Iberia cargo official told Reuters.
Iberia last adjusted its ex-France rates in November 1996 when increases of between two and four percent were applied.

Iberia operates seven flights daily from Paris to Madrid using Airbus 300 and 320 passenger aircraft and also serves several other Spanish cities from the French capital including Barcelona, Seville, Valencia and Zaragoza.
The airline also trucks airfreight between France and Spain. -Reuters Air Cargonewsroom Tel+44-171-542-7706 Fax 5017
